newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends lower on greenback demand.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends lower on greenback demand.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar finished lower against its U.S. counterpart on Monday on strong demand for the greenback due to overseas payments, dealers said.
The local unit closed at T$27.622 against Saturday's T$27.580, off an intraday low of T$27.630.
Turnover through dealers was a heavy T$361 million.
"The dollar began to retreat after the first hour of trading as demand for the greenback started rising," said a dealer at a foreign bank.
The Taiwan dollar had been stable at T$27.577 against the U.S. unit, with negligible trade in the first 45 minutes.
